code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseTools: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://sahithivarma07.github.io/sparseTools/}, }

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: sparseTools R package implements S4 class sparse numeric vectors, called sparse_numeric. use provide class sparse numeric vectors along methods work witht hose vectors without ever converting dense vector Rather storing every zero, class stores : non-zero values positions full length vector

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: sparse_numeric object stores: value: numeric vector non-zero entries pos: integer vector corresponding positions length: full length dense vector package implements:

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Convert numeric → sparse: (x, "sparse_numeric") Convert sparse → numeric: (x, "numeric") .numeric(x) method

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: sparse_add(x, y) sparse_sub(x, y) sparse_mult(x, y) sparse_crossprod(x, y) (dot product) Overloaded operators: +, -, *

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(sparseTools)  # Create a sparse vector from a regular numeric vector x <- as(c(0, 3, 0, 5), "sparse_numeric") x as.numeric(x)  # Compute mean (includes zeros) mean(x)  # Euclidean norm norm(x)  # Standardize the vector (z-score) s <- standardize(x) as.numeric(s)  # Arithmetic y <- as(c(1, 0, 2, 0), "sparse_numeric")  as.numeric(x + y) as.numeric(x - y) as.numeric(x * y)  # Dot product sparse_crossprod(x, y)

what: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
title: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
text: Represents sparse numeric vector storing non-zero values, positions, full length underlying dense vector.

title: Sparse numeric vector S4 class — sparse_numeric-class
text: value Numeric vector non-zero values. pos Integer vector positions non-zero values (1-based). length Single integer giving full length vector.
